body: This happens on a Windows Insider build? I couldn't reproduce it reproduce on 1903.
That's on 1903. Maybe I have some bugged dll left over... such things happened to me in the past, not related to scaling. I may be able to try this on another pc.
Yup, or it could be my PC having a non-standard setting somewhere. Either way, thank you for finding and reporting this, as always! Hope we can pin it down.
Tried this on other PC, the same problem.

Someone has had the same issue (posted 2 years ago) https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47019924/windows-10-dpi-scaling-and-fullscreen

>After further testing, the WM_GETDPISCALEDSIZE message doesn't even seem to be sent if the window is fullscreen, only if it's windowed (WS_POPUP works but only if the size isn't the same as the monitor). Therefore I can't even override this behaviour, and Windows 8.1 works different to Windows 10 v1703 for fullscreened windows.
@ghuser404 Thank you for all that information! I should be able to reproduce the bug now.

@elmindreda Thanks for the fix, it works well for the fullscreen scenario and all. However, this doesn't fix it for the borderless window that covers the monitor (aka fullscreen borderless mode) - Windows has special treatment for such windows.

I know the original ticket description didn't specify this scenario. Should we reopen this ticket or create a new one?
